alert.note: Alert for Eastern Rogue Valley; Siskiyou Mountains; Southern Oregon Cascades; Umpqua National Forest; Western Rogue Basin including the Illinois Valley (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued September 05 at 6:55PM PDT until September 06 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 8 PM PDT TUESDAY FOR STRONG GUSTY WIND AND LOW RH FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 617, 620, 621, 622, AND 623... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zone 617, including the Windigo fire, and zones 620, including the Rum Creek fire, 621, 622, and 623. * WIND...Northwest winds 10 to 20 mph with gusts as high as 30 mph. * HUMIDITY...6 to 13 percent. * DETAILED URL...View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Avoid tossing burning cigarettes on the ground, parking hot vehicles on dry vegetation, and using equipment that can cause sparks. Follow all fire restrictions. Find links to restrictions at weather.gov/medford/wildfire. One less spark, one less wildfire. Gather your fire evacuation kit now. Collect essentials you don`t want to lose and prioritize your checklist. Visit ready.gov/kit for more information. Familiarize yourself with your evacuation plan. Where will you go? How will you get there? Who will you call to let others know your are safe? Visit ready.gov/wildfires for more information. A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now or will shortly. These conditions promote rapid spread of fire which may become life threatening. Evacuate if ordered to, or if a fire threatens.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Rogue Valley; Siskiyou Mountains; Southern Oregon Cascades; Umpqua National Forest; Western Rogue Basin including the Illinois Valley
